title: BougeRV’s telescopic lantern is ridiculously versatile
snippets: BougeRV's LED lantern, marketed as an outdoor camplight, functions as a versatile work lamp suitable for various lighting needs. It features a rechargeable, compact design with three adjustable LED panels that emit 3000 lumens, ideal for illuminating campsites, workspaces, or engine blocks.
summary: BougeRV has released an LED lantern designed for outdoor camping, which also serves as a multifunctional work lamp. It boasts a rechargeable, compact form and has three adjustable LED panels that produce 3000 lumens, making it suitable for lighting up campsites, workspaces, and engine blocks.

title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction halting efforts by the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency to dismantle the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB). This decision will remain in effect until the resolution of an active court case.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has announced that in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, it will remove a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up Windows 11 devices without an internet connection and logging in. This move enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and to have a user account for setup.
summary: Microsoft will update the Windows 11 Insider Preview to eliminate a script that let users set up the system without an internet connection or logging in. This change mandates that all Windows 11 devices must be connected to the internet and require a user account for setup.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway and will run until Monday, March 31st. The sale features a wide range of deals that are accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. A comprehensive roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, alongside a selection of low-cost alternatives for budget-conscious shoppers.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is happening now through March 31st, offering a variety of deals on over 100 items, including popular gear and budget-friendly options. The sale is open to all shoppers, not just Amazon Prime members.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X, previously known as Twitter, in an all-stock deal. Musk, who bought Twitter for $44 billion years earlier, announced the acquisition, valuing xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, with the latter carrying $12 billion in debt.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, has bought the social media platform X (formerly Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, despite X having $12 billion in debt. Musk, who previously purchased Twitter for $44 billion, announced this acquisition.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This feature, aimed at IT professionals, enables the remote recovery of devices that are unable to boot. The development follows Microsoft's announcement last year, intending to prevent incidents similar to the previous Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft has introduced a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This feature is designed for IT professionals to remotely recover devices that cannot boot. This development comes after Microsoft's announcement last year, aiming to avoid situations like the Crowdstrike incident.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026

summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts to next year. This decision follows Google's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021, where they initially set a 2025 deadline for users to migrate their accounts.

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have created an advanced AI model that improves predictions on chemotherapy responses in muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients. This model uniquely combines whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analysis, offering more accurate predictions than earlier methods relying on a single data type.
summary: Researchers have developed a new AI model that enhances the accuracy of predicting chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients by integrating whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analysis. This approach outperforms previous methods that used only one type of data.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have discovered a link between dopamine and cognitive flexibility, showing through PET imaging that increased dopamine production in the brain during challenging tasks improves task efficiency. This finding could lead to better treatment options for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Scientists have found that higher dopamine production in the brain is linked to improved cognitive flexibility, making tasks more efficient. This discovery, made using PET imaging during challenging tasks, could enhance treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen
snippets: Researchers have discovered that the immune system can identify and manage the dormant phase of Toxoplasma gondii, a parasite. This insight could help understand how to control latency in other nervous system infections.
summary: Researchers have found that the immune system can detect and control the inactive stage of Toxoplasma gondii, a parasite. This discovery may aid in understanding how to manage dormant infections in the nervous system.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: A study analyzing nearly 270,000 seed plant species globally has examined why certain plants prosper in specific areas but not in others, focusing on the impact of environmental conditions and dispersal barriers. The research aims to understand the distribution patterns of plant diversity and their evolution over millions of years.
summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species aimed to understand why some plants thrive in certain regions but not in others, focusing on the role of environmental conditions and dispersal barriers. The research explores the distribution and evolution of plant diversity over millions of years.
